Erik Wilde (@dret): Creating the Composable Enterprise

(2) Summary

Digital transformation not only requires a specific focus on digital opportunities, it also requires the ability to change and adapt easily. Managing everything as a building block makes every capability easily usable and reusable. In a digital world, building blocks become digital building blocks, and all capabilities of an enterprise should be managed as digital building blocks. While the general idea is well-known and accepted, many organizations struggle with how to put the general idea into action. We look at the value proposition and how it translates into clear requirements for an Application Programming Interface (API) platform. We also look into how to define a strategy and a program so that organizations make progress towards establishing and evolving their API platforms.

(7) Digital Transformation Definition

Digital Transformation means adapting an organization's strategy and structure to capture opportunities enabled by digital technology. (Nathan Furr and Andrew Shipilov, Digital Doesn't Have to Be Disruptive, Harvard Business Review 97(4), July/August 2019, pp. 94-103) [https://hbr.org/2019/07/digital-doesnt-have-to-be-disruptive]



Building (with) Building Blocks Erik Wilde (@dret): Creating the Composable Enterprise

Building (with) Building Blocks Erik Wilde (@dret): Creating the Composable Enterprise

(9) API Usage in 2025



Building (with) Building Blocks Erik Wilde (@dret): Creating the Composable Enterprise

(10) Jeff Bezos' Services Rant: The Rules [https://gist.github.com/chitchcock/1281611]

  • Famous small set of SOA design rules
    • Teams must expose functionality through services
    • Communication happens only through service interfaces
    • There are no hard guidelines for service design
    • Internal/external service is a matter of policy, not one of design
  • Going against the let's pick a platform spirit of old-school SOA


Building (with) Building Blocks Erik Wilde (@dret): Creating the Composable Enterprise

(11) Jeff Bezos' Services Rant: The Consequences

  • With more freedom comes more responsibility
    • Monitoring and metrics are necessary for finding root causes
    • All APIs must be hardened against DoS attacks
    • Automated QA is necessary to really understand service health
    • Services must be documented and registered so that they can be discovered
    • Debugging becomes harder because of service dependencies
  • Sophisticated tooling required to manage the new SOA landscape
  • Much easier in today's technology landscape than 16 years ago


Building (with) Building Blocks Erik Wilde (@dret): Creating the Composable Enterprise

(12) Jeff Bezos' API Mandate



Building (with) Building Blocks Erik Wilde (@dret): Creating the Composable Enterprise

(13) A Cautionary Tale

  • Many organizations are adding social features to their products/experiences
  • Protecting against trolling, spam, and harassment is important
  • Building robust social protections is not trivial
  • Organizations end up with dependencies in their value chains

(16) Execution Matters

Amateurs talk about strategy and tactics. Professionals talk about logistics and sustainability [â¦]. (Robert H. Barrow [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_H._Barrow])


The Execution Gap Erik Wilde (@dret): Creating the Composable Enterprise

(17) Leadership 1-2-3

  • Set a vision as the goal to improve the organization
    • Digital Transformation will help us to thrive in the increasingly digitalized world
  • Define a strategy how to turn the vision into reality
    • APIs are a necessary component of digital transformation
  • Have a program to turn the defined strategy into reality
    • Designing and building good APIs has business, organizational, and technical aspects

API Management Erik Wilde (@dret): Creating the Composable Enterprise

(19) API Management is Evolving

  • API management means different things to different people
  • It has been evolving with the practice and tooling
  • It is growing in scope with the growing importance of APIs


API Management Erik Wilde (@dret): Creating the Composable Enterprise

(20) Technical API Management



API Management Erik Wilde (@dret): Creating the Composable Enterprise

(21) Technical API Management Focus

  • Securing APIs against unauthorized access
  • Managing authentication and authorization for API access
  • Protecting APIs with mechanisms such as throttling


API Management Erik Wilde (@dret): Creating the Composable Enterprise

(22) API Lifecycle Management



API Management Erik Wilde (@dret): Creating the Composable Enterprise

(23) API Lifecycle Management Focus

  • Looking at APIs as evolving over time
  • Making API development more effective
  • Adding components for tasks such as testing and analytics


API Management Erik Wilde (@dret): Creating the Composable Enterprise

(24) API Product Management



API Management Erik Wilde (@dret): Creating the Composable Enterprise

(25) API Product Management Focus

  • Applying a value-oriented perspective to turn APIs into API products
  • Separating API products from their technical management
  • Using product catalogs to allow for diverse landscapes


API Management Erik Wilde (@dret): Creating the Composable Enterprise

(26) API Product Marketing



API Management Erik Wilde (@dret): Creating the Composable Enterprise

(27) Building Blocks are Driving Value

  • Actively market building blocks that can drive value
  • Manage the building block portfolio
  • Provide specific building blocks for specific audiences


Getting APIs to Work

Getting APIs to Work Erik Wilde (@dret): Creating the Composable Enterprise

(29) Good APIs are Necessary

  • There is no digital transformation without good APIs
  • Good APIs are the result of purposefully designing digital building blocks
  • Good APIs are useful and usable


Getting APIs to Work Erik Wilde (@dret): Creating the Composable Enterprise

(30) API Patterns

  • There is a detailed capability map/model for the organization
  • Capabilities are designed and created to be reusable components
  • Product management always includes the digital side of a product


Getting APIs to Work Erik Wilde (@dret): Creating the Composable Enterprise

(31) API Anti-Patterns

  • There is no API strategy, program, or platform
  • Many APIs are not documented and their function is unclear
  • Many APIs have one consumer and thus are not reused/reusable
  • API design and implementation are treated as an after-thought


Conclusions

Outline (Conclusions)

Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): Creating the Composable Enterprise

(33) APIs Matter

  • APIs are the plumbing of digital transformation
  • API platforms are where building blocks are shared and used
  • Good APIs are aligned with business capabilities


Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): Creating the Composable Enterprise
